events.title: Strategic Shift: Limiting Operations in Circus Offensive to Enhance Focus
events.description: 16r. Meanwhile, on 21st October, I carried the reduction in the scale of the   Circus   offensive a stage further by imposing on No. 11 Group, as the,Group principally concerned, a limit of six such operations a month.

events.title: General Sir Frederick A. Pile Submits Detailed Report to War Secretary â€“ October 1946
events.description: The following despatch was submitted to the Secretary of State for War ow the 21st October, 1946, by GENERAL SIR FREDERICK A. PILE, Bt, G.C.B., D.S.0., M.C., General Officer Commandingin-Chief, Anti-Aircraft Command.

events.title: Naval Force Completes Safe Passage to Scapa After Brief Encounter with Enemy Aircraft
events.description: 2. The passage was made without incident, save for one sighting by enemy aircraft: the force reached Kola Inlet on 21st October, sailed the next day and arrived at Scapa on 28th October.

events.title: Allied Forces Face Tough Odds in Southern Italy: A Numerical Stalemate Ahead of Strategy Shifts
events.description: I reviewed the situation in the light of these considerations on 21st October. In Southern Italy eleven Allied divisions were opposing nine German in a position eminently suitable for the defence, while in the north there were some fourteen more, a known total of twentythree divisions.* Eleven against nine was no great numerical superiority and with their great resources in the north, where the internal security commitment was now quite unimportant, the Germans could easily convert it into a positive inferiority; at the least they could carry out constant reliefs of their formations in the battle area and oppose our attacks with constantly fresh troops. This was what they

events.title: Governor-General Updates India Office with Detailed Recommendations on October 21, 1943
events.description: The above recommendations were accepted and telegraphed with observations in greater detail, by the Governor-General to H.M. Government (India Office) on 21st October, 1943.

events.title: Planned Airstrike Postponed: Moonless Night Forces Changes in Military Operations
events.description: 7. The attack was first planned to take place on the night of 21st October, but owing to a fire in ILLUSTRIOUS  hangar a few days before, which destroyed and damaged a number of aircraft, the operation had to be deferred. It was considered again for the night of 30th/ 31st October, when the fleet was operating off the West coast of Greece, but it was decided not to attempt it as there was then no moon and the attack would have had to be carried out with flares, in the use of which the aircraft crews had had little practice.
